Puming Puming
Shi Puming, originally named Fajing, was a member of the Zhu clan and a person from Kuaiji. From a young age, his aspirations and conduct were extraordinary.
There was a monk begging for food who encouraged him, saying,
Since you have a good nature,
you should go to Mount Tiantai to become a monk.
There is a first-stage bodhisattva who expounds the Dharma there.
Thus, in the fourteenth year of the Taijian era of Chen,
he crossed mountains and valleys to enter Mount Tiantai.
He happened to meet Zhizhe sitting and expounding the Dharma.
Zhizhe smiled and said,
Due to the power of your past vows, we have now met.
He followed Zhizhe to Yuquan Temple in Jingzhou.
He always practiced austerities and focused his thoughts by the spring.
Zhizhe returned to Mount Tiantai and ordered him to cast a large bell for offerings at Tiantai.
The monks and laypeople of Jiangling competed in making preparations.
When they were about to cast it, a blind person came to watch.
Puming had clairvoyance and knew that the auspicious signs were not good, and it turned out to be so.
When the mold was opened, the bell was broken and cracked.
Later, when he returned to Guoqing Temple, the room he stayed in
was far from the water.
The empty ground in front of the room was full of limestone.
He still thought to himself,
If I could make water come out of this stone, wouldn't it be great?
After saying this, in a few days, a spring gushed out from the stone.
It provided water to the east and west.
Guoqing Temple.
Established by Emperor Gao of the Sui Dynasty.
Ming wanted to demolish and expand the lecture hall because it was too small.
He discussed it with Chan Master Ding.
Ding advised him not to change it.
The Governor of Kuaiji, Zhou Xiaofei, heard about this from afar.
He donated pine pillars and sent them across the sea.
Ding had a vision in Cheng, seeing Ming's body more than ten zhang tall.
Towering above the pine forest.
Dozens of attendants said to Ding,
Brother, don't insist on opposing it. I hope this matter will be accomplished.
Ding knew it was a divine manifestation and joined his palms, replying,
I dare not oppose it any further. I will follow your instructions.
On the day of erecting the hall, the mountain king was moved.
In the morning, the hidden wheels seemed like thunder.
It knocked down trees and branches, covering an area of a hundred steps.
From the Buddha's tomb down to the temple.
By the time the sun set, it returned to its original trace.
With a loud noise, it seemed as if it had just arrived.
He also wished to build a hall and a golden bronze Vairocana Buddha statue, sitting sixteen feet tall, together with the monks and laypeople.
At that time, a person claimed to have come from Caoxi Village.
He donated eleven taels of gold to be used for the Buddha statue.
When asked about his name and surname, he refused to say.
He bowed and took his leave.
When inquired about in that village, no one recognized him.
The attendant monk in the next room always heard the master talking with someone in his room.
He secretly watched but saw no other form.
The words he heard only encouraged the practice of goodness.
After that, the master completed his transformative work.
When the time of his great passing was approaching, he called his disciples in the early morning and said:ğŸ”½Human life is impermanent.
It cannot last forever.
You should all be aware of this.
He then took off his new clean clothes and put on his old worn ones.
As soon as he changed his clothes, he suddenly passed away.
Xuanguang, Xuanguang Shi Xuanguang was a person from Xiongzhou in the East Sea.
He was intelligent from a young age.
He went to Mount Heng to see Great Master Si.
Later, he returned to Jiangnan.
At that time, the ships of his home country were loaded and leaving the shore.
At that time, colorful clouds confused the eyes.
Elegant music boiled in the air.
With a purple flag and rainbow banners.
The voice of transmission in the sky said:
The Heavenly Emperor summons Chan Master Xuanguang from the East Sea.
Xuanguang cupped his hands and made way.
He only saw a blue-robed person leading the way.
In a short while, he entered the palace city.
It was not a human official residence.
The arrangements of feathered guards were all non-human and non-divine.
Some said:
Today, the Heavenly Emperor descended to the Dragon King's palace.
He invited the master to speak about the Dharma gate of personal realization.
We, the water officials, have been benefited by the master.
After ascending the jeweled hall, he then climbed the high stage.
As if asking, he spoke for about seven days.
Then the king personally saw him off.
The ship floated on the ocean but did not move forward.
Guang boarded the ship again.
The ship's crew said it had only been half a day.
Guang returned to Xiongzhou and Mount Weng.
He planted his staff and thatched hut, which then became a Buddhist temple.
After that, no one knew where he went.
Mingda, Shi Mingda.
His surname was Kang.
His ancestors were from the Kangju country.
He left home as a child.
He strictly observed the precepts. When he reached the age of full ordination, his practice became even more lofty.
He did not lie on his side on a bed, and did not eat twice a day.
His external appearance was disciplined, and internally he planted the causes of the Way.
His mind was on the vast salvation of all, and he traveled around to fulfill his mission.
In the first year of the Tianjian era of the Liang dynasty, he came from the Western Regions to Yizhou.
At that time, the barbarians of the Baxi region were raiding and robbing.
The prefectures and counties raised troops to exterminate them by a set date.
Da felt pity for their suffering and was determined to save them.
He went alone to the bandits' stronghold.
He comforted and attracted them, not yet familiar with their feelings.
Suddenly, the wind and rain darkened, and thunder and lightning struck.
The bandits were frightened and terrified, and they begged for mercy.
Dharmaraká¹£a then taught them to prepare a thousand lamps and sincerely rely on the Three Jewels.
When the preparations were made,
the darkness and haze immediately cleared.
The mountains and marshes communicated with each other.
The heavens and earth opened up and became bright.
They all looked up to the king.
They all followed the king's transformation.
Thus, the Jiang road became peaceful and clear, and coming and going were unobstructed.
Later, while traveling, he encountered a pig tied on the ground by people.
It made human sounds and said:
Please, Supreme Sage, save me.
Dharmaraká¹£a then untied his robe to redeem and release it.
Once in the middle of the night, he asked for water to wash his feet.
His disciples did as he said.
But the mud did not come off.
He then washed it with hot water as before, but it still did not come off.
He then poured water on it himself.
His feet immediately became clean.
Dharmaraká¹£a said:
This is fish fat.
No one could fathom where it came from.
He went to Niutou Mountain in Zizhou.
He wanted to build a stupa and a monastery.
He did not look for timber or stone, but only sought craftsmen.
Monks and laypeople all found his words strange.
At that time, in the third month, the water had dried up, so he went down to look for wood.
He found a long piece of timber in the water.
It was just right for the stupa pillar.
The length and width were just right.
Everyone was delighted.
They pulled it out and erected it.
By the fourth month, the Fu River had flooded greatly.
Driftwood filled the river.
It stopped at the village bank and none flowed past.
Dashi and the monks and laypeople all joined in to collect it.
They piled it up on the side of the mountain.
They began to build a hall and a nine-story pagoda.
People from far and near joined forces to build it all at once.
The construction was completed in no time.
He personally wore three robes, all of coarse cloth.
When they were torn, he would mend them. He had no new clothes for cold or hot weather.
Sometimes he would sit in meditation on a rope bed.
A fire suddenly broke out, and people rushed to put it out.
They only felt cool and refreshing.
There was a monk named Sengjiu.
He had accumulated illnesses and was crippled, coming to ask for a cure.
Da then gave him a cane to walk with.
Before the hour had passed, he took quick steps and returned.
Also, during the poá¹£adha ceremony, he sat ahead of the assembly.
There was a thief who broke through the wall and carried off goods. After coming out, he was confused about the direction and returned to the temple.
He was then sent away.
In the 15th year of Tianjian, he returned to Jingzhou with the King of Shixing.
In the 12th month of winter, he passed away in Jiangling.
Da Shun Da Shun, Shi Da Shun.
It is unknown where he was from.
He stayed in a quiet forest, protecting the Way and hiding himself.
His words always contained a smile, and his talks were pure and far-reaching.
He once stayed on Yangtou Mountain in Zezhou.
The place where Shen Nong determined medicine was built with thatched huts.
He had no other savings.
He only ate one meal a day and always sat through the year.
He was moved by snakes and rats living together.
under a rope bed.
Each gave birth without any danger or harm.
Also, a tiger came and crouched beside them.
Then he preached the Dharma for it.
Someone returned to the dwelling and told the tiger to leave.
Or he said to it:
Tomorrow people will come. You don't need to come.
Then it was as Shun said, and the tiger disappeared.
The attendants lived with the tiger.ğŸ”½They were as intimate as a house dog, and no one was afraid of it.
He wore tattered robes, with little to collect.
He walked barefoot in the forest, not choosing between morning and evening.
In the beginning of the Kaihuang era, he suddenly wandered into the village, preaching the Dharma and transforming the villagers. They all gathered to receive the Dharma.
He alone did not give precepts to a woman.
He said:
You will be reborn as a cow. The signs have already appeared.
The precepts cannot save you.
Only karma that is not fixed can help each other.
At that time, there were those who did not believe his words and thought he was confusing the crowd.
All had doubts.
Shun wanted to decide on the opinions of the crowd.
He told the assembly:
If you still do not believe it, try stepping on the shadow of your cow's tail. It will definitely not move.
He then stepped on the empty ground behind the woman's skirt and said:
This is the shadow of the tail.
The woman followed his words and tried to get up, but she could not.
At that time, the assembly was amazed and believed.
They requested Shun to say:
How can we remove this karmic retribution?
The woman's family had accumulated tens of thousands of bushels of grain.
Fearing the evil karma, they immediately gave it all away.
Shun used it all to create blessings for them and had them repent.
In this way, he repeatedly eliminated the evil karma and then had them receive the precepts.
He either relied on the leper villages to receive their offerings,
or he saw the pus and fluid flowing outside,
and he would use his mouth to suck on it.
He had no evil thoughts.
Sometimes he would wash their clothes,
or purify their minds and karma.
He took it upon himself to do this.
He was delighted and never frowned.ğŸ”½Later, he traveled to the vast valley of Linlu,
and went north to Pan Pavilion in Jin.
He practiced Chan meditation in the Hidden Temple of the Mountains, and his end is unknown.ğŸ”½Daoxian, Shi Daoxian.
Also known as Sengxian.
Originally from Kangju.
At first, he made his living as a merchant.
Later, he met Chan Master Sengda, who expounded the Dharma for him.
He then sank his precious boat in the river.
He took leave of his wife and children and left the family to enter the Bamboo Grove Temple in Guankou.
On the day of his initial tonsure, he vowed before the assembly:
If I do not attain the Way, I will not leave this mountain.
He then secluded himself from human traces and built a dwelling in the rocky valley.
Fellow practitioners of Chan meditation gathered there one after another.
Whenever he read a sutra, as soon as he saw the words The Buddha was at such-and-such a place, he would be choked with sobs.
Why did I not meet him? I only see his remaining writings.
But Daoxian was extraordinary, not like others. He lived in the wilderness, befriending birds and beasts.
If anyone came to ask about the methods of learning,
he would all answer skillfully and in accordance with the correct principles.
From the beginning, whenever he entered meditation, he would sit for four or five days at a time.
He would judge whether a guest had arrived at his door.
Suddenly he would become aware and rise to greet them.
If there were no visitors, he would sit upright in a quiet room.
Silent like empty space.
Sometimes he would predict that guests would arrive the next day.
Whether it was a hundred or a thousand, it was all as he said.
Never lacking or exceeding.
The Prince of Shixing of the Liang Dynasty, Dan, lowered his curtain in the three Shu regions.
He treated Xian with the respect of a teacher and brought him to Shan.
At that time, the Daoist academy was grand and the Daoist practitioners were numerous.
They scolded each other and deeply worried about it.
Xian remained calm and did not care at all.
One night, the Daoists suddenly saw a fire burning on the eastern hill, fearing that the wild fire would burn Xian.
Each holding a water vessel, they came to save him.
They saw Xian sitting in the middle of a great fire, with raging flames burning.
They all marveled at the spiritual virtue of the fire light.
The Daoist Li Xuzu and others.
Donated land to create statues, temples, and stupas that were suddenly completed.
Nine out of ten people in the far and near areas took refuge and believed in him.
The Prefect of the state, the Prince of Panyang, personally paid respects and received the Dharma.
At the end of the Tianjian era, the King of Shixing had a mysterious feeling.
At Liangta Temple, he made images of the Four Heavenly Kings.
Every six zhai days, he always set up pure offerings.
After Xian attended the assembly,
five-colored light emitted from the tops of the Four Heavenly Kings.
The incense burner held by Xian naturally emitted flames.
Lu Fahe, the Grand Marshal, was once very humble.
For many years, he served Xian on the mountain.
There were monks who reprimanded him.
Xian said,
He is a noble minister of the Three Offices. Why do you insult him?
At that time, no one could fathom his future nobility.
Lu Fahe indeed rose to the rank of Grand Master of Ceremonies.
When Xian was sometimes ill, he saw a boy in light-colored clothes emerge from the blue stream, fill a bowl with wonderful medicine, and kneel to offer it.
After taking it, he quickly recovered.
He lived in the mountains for twenty-eight years.
He then traveled to Jingluo, greatly promoting the Way.
At that time, there was a severe drought, and the people requested rain.
Xian then went to the dragon's cave and knocked on the door with his staff, saying several times,
Why are sentient beings so fond of sleep?
After speaking, the sky immediately darkened with clouds and a heavy rain poured down.
The people relied on this blessing.
All came to pray and pay homage.
Admiring him like a celestial deity.
If anyone needed relics, he would pray for them.
They would arrive as needed.
The Prince of Shu of the Sui Dynasty, Wang Xiu, was stationed in Minluo and had heard of the prince.
He soon sent someone to summon him, but he did not obey the order at all.
The prince was furious and his expression changed.
He personally led troops to capture him.
If he stubbornly refused, he would be killed.
When Xian heard that the troops had arrived, he was not afraid at all.
He asked for his saá¹ƒghÄá¹­Ä« robe, put it on, and sat upright, contemplating the Buddha.
When the king reached the foot of the mountain, suddenly clouds and rain mixed with hail and snow poured down.
The water filled the river, and the carts were stranded with no way out.
When the situation became desperate, he then bowed from afar and repented.
Then, when it became light and the rain cleared, the mountain road became peaceful and he was able to reach Xian's place.
The king personally paid his respects and An Shigao then expounded the Dharma for him, causing him to generate faith anew.
He then invited An Shigao to return to Jingzhong Temple in Chengdu.
With abundant offerings and reverence, the entire country paid homage to him.
He was called Immortal UpÄdhyÄya.
In the Kaihuang years, he returned to the mountain temple.
The road spontaneously became clean, with mountain spirits sweeping in front of him.
At over a hundred years old, he sat upright and passed away.ğŸ”½Fa'an, Shi Fa'an, with the surname Peng,
was a person from Qunyu in Anding.
He left home at a young age and practiced Chan at Jilong Temple on Mount Taibo.
He ate coarse food and wore poor clothes until the end of his life.
In the Kaihuang years, he came to Jiangdu and was introduced to Prince Jin.
At that time, because of his short stature and vulgar appearance, and his lighthearted speech and laughter, he was not considered important.
He would come to the gate every day, but was sent away and not allowed to stay.
Try introducing him.
When the king heard, he summoned him in and saw him as an old acquaintance.
He then stayed at Huiji Temple.

Wherever the king went, he carried it with him. When he went to Mount Tai, he encountered thirst. Looking around, there were only cliffs, with no way to get water. An took his sword to pierce the rock, and the water gushed out to provide for the emperor. At that time, the emperor greatly admired it and asked, What power is this?
He replied, It is the power of the king.
When he followed the king into the sand and gravel, he reached the mud sea, and there were changes that should have been encountered.
They all avoided them in advance and suffered no harm.
Later, he went to Shentong Temple on Mount Tai.
The monks came to invite An to be their patron.
The king then wrote with his own hand on the temple wall to promote protection.
At first, he entered the valley with the king.
An saw a monk wearing tattered clothes riding a white donkey coming.
The king asked, Who is this?
An said,
This is Master Lang.
He is creating Shentong Temple, so he came to welcome us.
When they arrived at the temple,
they also saw a deity with a very majestic appearance.
He was leaning his hand on the roof ridge, looking down at the crowd of people.
The king asked about it again.
He replied,ğŸ”½This is the deity of Mount Tai.
This mountain god of Mount Tai is a follower of the king.
After that, all the wonders cannot be recorded in detail.
In the eleventh year of the spring,
there were many difficulties in the four directions.
He passed away without illness at the place where he stayed.
He was ninety-eight years old.
Zhiyi, Shi Zhiyi.
The word is De'an.
His surname is Chen.
He is a person from Yingchuan.
His mother, Lady Xu,
dreamed of five-colored incense smoke swirling around her chest.
She wanted to brush it away.
She heard a voice say,
The karmic conditions from past lives are entrusted to the path of birth.
How can you remove it when blessings and virtues naturally come to you?
She also dreamed of swallowing a white rat.
This happened twice.
She found it strange and divined it.
The master said,
It is a sign of a white dragon.
On the night of his birth, the room was illuminated.
After two nights, the light stopped.
Suddenly, two monks knocked on the door and said,
Excellent! The virtues of this child are heavy. He will surely leave the household life.
After saying this, they disappeared.
At the age of eighteen, he took refuge with the monk Fayu of Guyuan Temple in Xiangzhou and became a monk.
One day, Fayu spoke about Chan practice to purify the mind.
When speaking or silent, he often thought of the forest and fields. He then dreamed of ten thousand layers of cliffs with half the sun hanging in the clouds.
Beside them was the boundless blue sea, clear and still.
Below it, he saw a monk.
Shaking his hand, he stretched out his arm to the foot of the mountain.
Pulling Zhiyi up the mountain.
Zhiyi told his disciples what he saw in the dream.
They all said:
This is Mount Tiantai in Kuaiji.
It is the place where sages and worthies reside.
Previously, there was a monk named Dingguang from Qingzhou.
He had lived on this mountain for a long time.
For forty years.
Practicing meditation and wisdom together.
He was indeed a spiritual person.
Two years before Zhiyi arrived, heé¢„ told the mountain people:
There will be a great virtuous teacher coming to join you.
You should plant beans, make soy sauce, weave straw mats,
and build more houses to welcome him.
Zhiyi went to Tiantai and arrived at the mountain.
When he met Guang, he immediately expressed his joy.
Guang said,
Great virtuous friend,
do you remember when I was a young man on the mountain, waving my hand to call out to you?
Zhiyi was astonished.
He knew that the connection through dreams was real.
He also heard the sound of bells filling the valley.
The assembly all found it strange.
Guang said,
The bell is summoning those with karmic affinity. You can stay here.
Zhiyi then divined an auspicious place to live.
To the north of where Guang was staying, south of Luoxi, at the source of the mountain.
The place was secluded and open, easy to seek the truth.
The land was flat, the spring clear, he lingered and stayed overnight.
Suddenly he saw three people in black caps and red robes.
They presented a petition, saying,
You can practice the Way here.
Later, Zhiyi, on the top of Huading Peak to the north of the temple,
was alone in quiet meditation.
A great wind uprooted trees and thunder shook the earth.
Dragons and ghosts in thousands of groups, with a hundred different forms,
Spitting fire, screaming, terrifying, difficult to describe.
Then, suppressing the mind, enduring peacefully, he lost himself.
He also suffered from physical and mental pain, as if being burned by fire.
He also saw his deceased parents, their heads and knees, suffering and begging for mercy.
Zhiyi also relied on the forbearance of the Dharma, unmoving like a mountain.
Therefore, the two conditions of strength and softness that moved him immediately disappeared.
Suddenly, a divine monk from the Western Regions said to him:
Only by defeating the enemy can one be considered brave.
Every summer he would lecture on the VimalakÄ«rti Sutra.
Suddenly, he saw three rows of jeweled stairs descending from the sky.
There were dozens of Indian monks riding the stairs down.
They entered the hall to pay homage.
Holding incense burners, they circled Zhiyi three times.
After a long while, they disappeared.
On Mount Yuquan in Dangyang County, he established a monastery.
The emperor decreed that the temple be named One Sound.
In the past, the land was only desolate and dangerous, with violent divine beasts and snakes.
After the temple was established, there were no worries or troubles.
In the spring, there was a severe drought.
The people all said that the spirit was angry.
Zhiyi went to the spring source and led the assembly to chant sutras.
Then they felt the clouds rise and the rain pour down.
The false rumors disappeared by themselves.
The wife of Prince Jin suffered from illness and no medical treatment worked.
The prince sent Kaifu Liu Guyan and others.
To write a letter requesting Zhiyi's help.
He wished for Zhiyi to save his wife's illness.
Zhiyi then led his companions to set up a seven-day vegetarian feast.
Performing the repentance ritual of the Golden Light Sutra.
On the sixth night,
Suddenly a strange bird descended and flew into the vegetarian altar.
It rolled around and died, then flew away in an instant.
They also heard the sound of a piglet crying.
The entire assembly witnessed it together.
Zhiyi said,
The appearance of this sign means that the wife will recover.
The bird dying and then reviving symbolizes rising from the coffin again.
The piglet's hidden cry reveals the merit of the vegetarian feast.
By the next day, the wife's illness indeed improved.
On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month in the seventeenth year of the Kaihuang era,
Zhiyi sat upright in meditation and passed away in front of the great stone Buddha statue on Mount Tiantai.
He was sixty-seven years old.
Zhikuang, Shi Zhikuang.
His surname was Wang.
At first, his mother was pregnant.
She dreamed of entering a stream to bathe.
A young boy riding a treasure boat came and threw himself into the stream. She then woke up and became pregnant.
When he grew up, he was intelligent and practiced diligently.
At the end of the Liang dynasty, he became a strong man.
Later, he left secular life and followed the Way to study longevity techniques.
When he met a high monk, he received the precepts and became a Buddhist disciple.
His virtue moved people and he gradually showed his hidden traces.
Zhang Quan of Jiangling was blind in both eyes for two generations.
Zhikuang said:
In the tomb of your family, the coffin rests on an ancient well.
Move the tomb and open the well, you will surely find a way to cure it.
Following his words, the blind man could see the road.
He requested to be ordained.
The assembly all feared him.
So he cut firewood and offered it to the monks, staying in a secluded and quiet place.
He also said:
There is an ancient bell in the stream that can be dug out and hung in the temple.
The Prefect of Renzhou considered him a deceiver.
He whipped his back a hundred times, but there was no pain or injury.
He was then sent out of the court and detained in the Imperial Armory.
Those with strength tried to hang him with an eight-foot chain and beat his knees.
Bystanders said it would crush him to pieces.
But Kuang's appearance was unchanged and his flesh was also without a trace. The jailer said,
I have heard that the gentleman can endure hunger.
So he stopped eating for seven days.
His body color was as before. Seen walking in the market, the jail was still there.
Only then did he believe in the manifestation of the body.
In the third year of Dading, he begged from others for straw sandals.
Tonight I must leave in a hurry.
At the third watch, the entire city caught fire.
People came out from the four gates without leaking.
Seven thousand were burned to death.
Kuang, in prison, led two hundred prisoners out in peace.
At the age of forty, he finally received the tonsure.
After advancing to receive the precepts, he practiced asceticism.
A snake coiled by the side of his bed.
Every evening in the mountains, four lamps illuminated together.
Scholars and laypeople gathered like clouds, and it suddenly became a grand temple.
There was one who killed a duck to make an offering.
The duck spirit warned him at night, saying,
How could there be killing livestock to provide pure offerings?
Since then, he has stopped.
Once, when crossing a river, he and several dozen companions wanted to stay but could not, and wanted to leave but had no way.
Two boats came from the front bank without anyone taking them.
Kuang laughed and called out to them.
The boats themselves cut through the current and went straight to them.
They then used them to cross the river.
He warned them not to spread the word.
He also built the Buddha's Footprint Temple in Xianyang.
A cow gave birth to a calf, its head came out but then disappeared.
It had already passed the time of delivery, and the mother was about to die.
The monks told Kuang, who felt pity.
He replied:
This calf is a patron of the temple.
It has been using the monks' things without permission and is now coming to repay the debt.
It is ashamed and does not come out. The cow mother has nothing to do with it.
He then held an incense burner and admonished the calf:
You should quickly repay the debt. What shame is there in being born?
As soon as he spoke, it came out.
The mysterious signs of his spiritual anomalies cannot be fully recorded.
On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month in the twenty-ninth year of the Kaihuang era, he passed away at the Siwang Kaisheng Temple.
He set a deadline for himself.
Heavenly fragrance filled the room.
The entire temple played music.
He left in a southwest direction.
Shi Fachong, Shi Fachong.
His surname was Bi.
He was a person from Jiujiang.
He always recited the Lotus Sutra and read the Great Perfection of Wisdom Sutra.
The number of times he recited them is difficult to record.
He also repaired and built temples.
His heart was set on maintaining them.
In the end, he stayed at Huacheng Temple on the halfway peak of Mount Lu, practicing meditation.
Unless it was a matter for the monks, he never went out.
He often advised the monks not to let women enter the temple.
Above, it damages the Buddha's teachings; below, it causes vulgar rumors.
However, the world considers family business to be important, and there are those who do not follow his advice.
Chong sighed and said:
Not being born in the time of the Buddha is already a karmic offense.
If the true teachings are not practiced, it is fitting to die early.
How can I worry about not upholding the precepts in other lands?
So he threw himself off Xianglu Peak on this mountain.
He vowed to crush his body and bones to be reborn in the Pure Land.
In mid-air, his head suddenly turned upside down.
Slowly descending, he was placed in a deep valley.
Not a single hair was harmed.
The temple residents did not know this at first.
Later, someone went up to the peak.
Looking down from the path, more than a thousand fathoms below, he heard the sound of a person speaking.
He went to search for it.
It was Chong.
His life was still alive, and he was reciting as before.
Welcomed back to the temple.
The monks were moved by his death and stopped reciting the sutra for women for six years.
Only then did he pass away.
At that time, it was the height of summer.
But the corpse did not stink or rot.
It smelled like a ripe melon.
This was in the last year of the Kaihuang era.
Huiqian, Shi Huiqian, was from Qu'a.
He stayed at Daguishan Temple in Jiangzhou.
His spiritual powers were known to both the spirits and the world, but no one could understand them.
He revered the sacred images as if they were the real Buddha.
Whenever he saw a standing image, he did not dare to sit down.
